sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: A Cantor set is constructed by repeatedly removing the middle third of a segment. If we start with a segment of length 81, how many line segments will remain after we complete the 5th iteration of this process?
message_2: In the Cantor set construction, at each iteration, the number of line segments doubles. So, after the 5th iteration, there will be 2^5 = 32 line segments remaining.
